intro: Witheringia asterotricha, commonly known as the star-haired witheringia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its basal leaves that are densely covered with star-shaped hairs, giving it its common name. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Witheringia asterotricha is typically found in moist, rocky habitats and is noted for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage.
